text: This is a really immersive, nuanced look into this moment in Beto's career, including a long interview between @cd_hooks and Beto (who he's covered for years). It's an important part of his record.

text: The plan eventually busted, though the city is still trying to build the arena. Some local residents in the line of fire haven't forgotten. "We trusted in Beto, and he gave us away on a silver platter." https://prospect.org/article/beto-versus-barrio …
author: ddayen

text: This was the marketing presentation created to tout the plan. It depicts "old" El Paso as "dirty" and "lazy" and "new" El Paso as "educated" and "entrepreneurial."
author: ddayen

text: The plan envisioned the wholesale replacement of a low-income neighborhood, with nearly two thousand predominantly poorer, older people displaced. Beto voted for it initially, and then continued to support it through a growing backlash. https://prospect.org/article/beto-versus-barrio …
author: ddayen

text: Beto Versus the Barrio http://tinyletter.com/DavidDayen/letters/beto-versus-the-barrio …
author: ddayen

text: We are LIVE @theprospect with a long-read from @cd_hooks, on a pivotal moment in Beto O'Rourke's political career: when he supported the makeover and displacement of a low-income neighborhood in El Paso, a plan pushed by his developer tycoon father-in-law. https://prospect.org/article/beto-versus-barrio …
author: ddayen

text: Excited to receive this honor with these other great journalists and advocates next week.
author: ddayen
